intro: Linaria sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenis' toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, Linaria sintenisii is considered a rare and endangered species.
